file_content.text: Report. What's the status of our forces?
Havoc's good to go, Major. No casualties.
Havoc Squad is at full operating status. Zero casualties.
The walkers hit us pretty hard, but thanks to the Eighty-first, we pushed through with minimal losses.
Same for us. Minimal casualties.
The walkers put up a tough fight. We lost some good people, but the Safecrackers are still in fighting shape.
Enemy infantry was a breeze. Captain Marshall's men gave us cover, and we did what we do best--puncture and purge.
The Safecrackers made my men feel lazy by comparison. They'll have to save more Imps for us next time.
Enemy infantry was dug in good, but not good enough. We punched through without too many casualties.
Disabling the defenses was slow going, but straightforward enough. No losses.
Two crews fell in our charge, but all enemy armor was destroyed. Our defensive perimeter is established.
Enemy infantry only managed to disable one of our walkers before we routed them. All other walkers now defend this point.
We blasted through the enemy turrets and mines with minimal difficulty. All crews functional. They now defend this point in all directions.
We've made a major advance against the Empire's best. You should all be proud.
Good work, everyone.
Now you just have to hold this position until we get the man we came for. Stay sharp!
We will not fail you, Major!
We've just captured one of the most heavily entrenched fortresses in the entire Republic.
Kick back and relax.
Everyone take a breather, check your gear, and make sure you're ready if things get crazy again.
You got it, Major.
We've got a lot left to do, people. Don't go patting yourselves on the back just yet.
This was only the beginning.
There's no telling what else the Imps might have in store. So stay sharp and hold this ground no matter what!
Yes, sir, Major!
If Rakton's anywhere, he's in the command center. Here are the coordinates.
Good luck, Major. We'll be here if you need us.
In all likelihood, General Rakton is directing his forces from the command center. It can be found at these coordinates.
I'm ready to move when you are, Major.
I am ready to proceed when you are, Major.
I am prepared to proceed with our historic mission at your command, Major!
Let's go earn some fortune, fame and medals.
Yuun is ready to proceed when you are, Major.
Good luck, Major. We're all counting on you.
Major. Everyone's assembled and ready for action.
Major. All personnel and equipment are up to protocol and ready to begin operations.
Good of you to invite the Safecrackers out for the main event this time, Major. This will be the biggest fortress we've busted yet.
The Eighty-first couldn't be happier to be here. Between this op and Voss, your face will end up as our unit emblem.
Major. I am Lesher, commander of the Fifty-third Armored Platoon. We march at your command.
What's our intel on Rakton's defenses?
Let's get to work.
Heavy, and on full alert. They're holding position for now, so it's our move.
It's a pleasure to have you all here.
Welcome, everyone.
Being here is the highest of honors, Major.
Everybody ready to take out some Imps?
Time to bust some heads!
Yes, sir!
Intel shows three routes to the Bastion's main complex. Aerial scans confirm--and Rakton has different defenses set up on each route.
First approach, we've got walkers and war droids. On the second, a full infantry company. And the last one has all the fun toys--mines, turrets, you name it.
It's a ruse. Rakton wants us to think we can focus our attack on a single route.
Rakton is trying to steer us.
Then he folds in his other forces behind us. We need to hit on every front at once--completely overwhelm Rakton's defenses.
Sounds like a good plan to me, Major--let's make it happen.
How do you think we should go at this, Captain?
What do you think, Jorgan?
Ordinarily, the spread of Rakton's defenses would leave him weak to a combined assault down one approach. But that's just a ploy.
The approaches are too narrow for walkers and infantry to operate together. We should attack from all three routes simultaneously.
Captain, any thoughts on how to proceed?
What do you think, Dorne?
Imperial doctrine teaches that Republic tactics favor combined, directed assaults rather than the broader tactics favored by the Empire.
We should use their expectations to our advantage and surprise them by attacking all three routes at once.
We'll pick the weakest defenses, round up all of our forces and blast straight through to Rakton!
Let's just charge in!
Unfortunately, a combined charge will not be possible in the relative narrowness of the approach routes. We must divide our forces amongst all three.
The first route, guarded by walkers and war droids, is most dangerous. I suggest matching strength with strength--my armor against theirs.
I say we mix it up. The Safecrackers aren't afraid of a few walkers--what about your guys, Captain?
It'll be tough, but the Eighty-first came equipped for anything. Plus, if we go, you can save Lesher's walkers to flatten the Imp infantry.
Coria, Marshall, you're taking on the walkers.
The infantry gets this route.
You can count on us, Major.
We could mix it up. My boys can handle walkers and war droids--not easy, but doable. Leave Lesher's walkers to trounce their infantry.
Captain Lesher, I want your platoon to take on the Imp armor.
Our walkers will fight theirs.
We will carve through them easily, Major!
Lieutenant Coria, the walkers are all yours.
The Safecrackers get this one.
They'll never know what hit 'em.
I'll deal with the enemy armor myself.
Leave the walkers to me.
You must be crazy. Suit yourself, Major.
Route two is all infantry--a full company. They're dug in and ready to fight.
Will Havoc be taking on all of those soldiers, or do you want us to handle it, sir?
Coria, Marshall--you're up for this one.
Their infantry is all yours.
We'll take care of it, sir.
This part's on you, Lieutenant.
Their infantry is all yours.
Consider it handled, sir.
Leave the infantry to me.
Havoc will handle this.
Have fun. You'll have your work cut out for you, sir.
I'll leave it up to you, Lieutenant.
Your choice.
This seems like a job for numbers. We'll handle it.
Would you like my walkers to engage these defenses? Or do you wish to do so yourself?
Take your walkers and push straight through.
You can handle them.
With pleasure, Major.
My team can handle the infantry.
Havoc is on this.
As you command, Major.
I'll leave that up to you, Captain.
Your choice.
The Fifty-third will gladly accept this assignment, Major!
Since you're handling the big guys, that leaves infantry and armor for this. Who do you want to take on their infantry?
The Fifty-third should handle the infantry.
Lesher and his walkers.
We will do so with pleasure, Major!
The Safecrackers and the Eighty-first can handle these guys.
Infantry against infantry.
We'll make it happen, sir.
The Safecrackers should be more than a match for these Imps.
Infantry against infantry.
You can count on it, Major.
I'll let the two of you settle it.
Decide for yourselves.
Please leave this matter to us. We can engage infantry with far less risk of loss.
That leaves the walkers for the automated defenses. Sounds like we're all set.
The Safecrackers and the Eighty-first can handle the automated defenses. Sound good to you, Captain?
Whatever it takes, Lieutenant.
The Safecrackers will burn through those automated defenses like cheap flimsiplast. Are we set to go?
I guess that leaves the automated defenses for you, Major. Enjoy.
If Rakton's half the commander they say, he'll send speeders full of commandos to flank us as soon as we commit to the assault.
We'd better keep most of Havoc back here to cover the main assault forces. We'll regroup once we're inside the main complex.
One of General Rakton's most celebrated victories involved sending elite commandos behind his attackers via speeder to flank and disorient them.
I suggest holding most of Havoc Squad back in case he tries a similar tactic here. All units can then regroup upon breaching the main complex.
All right--you all know your jobs, and you know what's at stake.
Time to get to work.
If we fail here, the entire Republic is on the line. Are we going to let that happen?
Sir, no, sir!
Today, we take down the Empire's greatest general.
Everyone ready for glory?
If we succeed, we become the most famous soldiers in Republic history. Sound good?
In the middle of that fortress, the most dangerous Imperial alive is planning our destruction!
Let's kill 'em all!
It's our job to blast everything and everyone who gets between us and that man. Is that clear?
Sir, yes, sir!
Move out!
